alert.note: Alert for Baker; Ben Hill; Berrien; Colquitt; Cook; Dougherty; Early; Irwin; Lee; Miller; Mitchell; Tift; Turner; Worth (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 23 at 9:34AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT/8 PM EDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Alabama, Florida and Georgia, including the following areas, in southeast Alabama, Geneva and Houston. In Florida, Calhoun, Central Walton, Coastal Bay, Coastal Dixie, Coastal Franklin, Coastal Gulf, Coastal Jefferson, Coastal Taylor, Coastal Wakulla, Gadsden, Holmes, Inland Bay, Inland Dixie, Inland Franklin, Inland Gulf, Inland Jefferson, Inland Taylor, Inland Wakulla, Jackson, Lafayette, Leon, Liberty, Madison, North Walton and Washington. In Georgia, Baker, Ben Hill, Berrien, Brooks, Colquitt, Cook, Decatur, Dougherty, Early, Grady, Irwin, Lanier, Lee, Lowndes, Miller, Mitchell, Seminole, Thomas, Tift, Turner and Worth. * WHEN...Until 7 PM CDT/8 PM EDT/ this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The ground remains saturated from recent excessive rainfall. It will only take around 2 inches of rainfall in one hour at most locations to produce flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Baker; Ben Hill; Berrien; Colquitt; Cook; Dougherty; Early; Irwin; Lee; Miller; Mitchell; Tift; Turner; Worth
